pullrequest.title: GPS sensor, sensor noise, and spherical coordinates

content.raw:
Ahh, okay. Here are the definitions for required:

0: The element is optional, and only 1 may be present at the current tree level.

1: The element is mandatory, and only 1 may be present a the current tree level.

+: One or more are allowed.

*: Zero or more are allowed.
content.html:
Ahh, okay. Here are the definitions for required:

0: The element is optional, and only 1 may be present at the current tree level.

1: The element is mandatory, and only 1 may be present a the current tree level.

+: One or more are allowed.

*: Zero or more are allowed.

pull_request.title: GPS sensor, sensor noise, and spherical coordinates

pullrequest.title: GPS sensor, sensor noise, and spherical coordinates

content.raw:
Currently I've only implemented the WGS84 ellipsoid model of the earth's surface. Other planets could be modeled and other surface models could be used for earth.

Should I take out the data structure since there's only one option currently implemented?
content.html:
Currently I've only implemented the WGS84 ellipsoid model of the earth's surface. Other planets could be modeled and other surface models could be used for earth.

Should I take out the data structure since there's only one option currently implemented?

content.raw:
I think I don't know what the different values of the required attribute mean. I can guess, but I've never seen it documented. I haven't looked into the code yet.

I don't think there should be multiple noise elements.
content.html:
I think I don't know what the different values of the required attribute mean. I can guess, but I've never seen it documented. I haven't looked into the code yet.

I don't think there should be multiple noise elements.

content.raw: `<position>` and `<velocity>` could be confusing since they don't set a position or velocity. How about `<position_estimation>` and `<velocity_estimation>`, or something similar?
content.html: <position> and <velocity> could be confusing since they don't set a position or velocity. How about <position_estimation> and <velocity_estimation>, or something similar?
